Header: Cash and jewellery worth over Rs. 87mn robbed from Thalawa bank (Photos)
Content: It is estimated that the robbers have taken away cash and jewellery worth over Rs. 87 million from the branch of a state bank in Thalawa which had been broken into during the weekend. The robbers have cut opened three safes in the bank using gas cutters. 22.5kg of gold and Rs. 10.7 million in cash is missing. Preliminary investigations revealed that the robbers had entered the premises breaking the back door and they have also taken away the CCTV recorder and the siren has been deactivated. Police say this would the largest robbery at a financial entity in Anuradhapura.
